required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Trial of Apatinib Reverses Chemotherapy-Resistance of Patients With Advanced Gastric Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Trial of Apatinib Reverses Chemotherapy-Resistance of Patients With Advanced Gastric Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: A single arm study: Apatinib plus paclitaxel as the reverses treatment in advanced gastric cancer which paclitaxel-resistant.

detailed_description.textblock: This trial investigated the efficacy and safety of apatinib plus paclitaxel, as a treatment option for patients with advanced gastric cancer which paclitaxel-resistant.

clinical_study.condition: Malignant Neoplasm of Stomach Stage II

intervention.description: Apatinib (850 mg qd p.o.) until disease progression or intolerable toxicity or refused by the patients.

Paclitaxel-based chemotherapeutic regimens including: The POF regimen consisted of a 3-hour infusion of paclitaxel (135 mg/m2) followed by oxaliplatin (85 mg/m2) and Calcium Levofolinate (200 mg/m2).Subsequently, a 46-hour infusion of fluorouracil (2400 mg/m2) was administered using an ambulatory pump, repeating the cycle every 14 days. The PF regimen consisted of a 3-hour infusion of paclitaxel (135 mg/m2) followed by Calcium Levofolinate (200 mg/m2).Subsequently, a 46-hour infusion of fluorouracil (2400 mg/m2) was administered using an ambulatory pump, repeating the cycle every 14 days. Paclitaxel 80mg/m2 d1，d8，d15，repeating the cycle every 28 days other paclitaxel-based regimens
